intro: Sida pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered Sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow to white flowers and palmate leaves. It typically grows in wetlands and along waterways, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Sida pauciflora is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife species.
